ygData.subject: Re: Rambling a bit, was: Re: [EQ_women] Marriage question......
ygData.msgSnippet: Basicly it s up to you to decide what is and is not acceptable in how you interact with people in the game. You can create your own emotes in the following
ygData.messageBody:
Basicly it's up to you to decide what is and is not acceptable in how you
interact with people in the game. You can create your own emotes in the
following way:

/me slaps Joewoodelf

That will make the game say

Bangvyne slaps Joewoodelf

There are no easy answers to personal interactions, you need to figure
that stuff out yourself. My advice is have fun and try to not
unnecessarily hurt people's feelings, while at the same time ensuring
people respect your boundaries.

- Christina

On Fri, 15 Nov 2002, Brangvyne Accampo wrote:
> Salutations All!
>
> OK, thanks Christina.
>
> I've been noticing a couple of things of late which
> are probably not great mysteries to anyone here, but .
> . .
> One is that a lot of the females on EQ are male in rl.
> Another is that once people start finding out your
> female in rl the males start hanging around a lot
> more.
> :o)
> It's kind of laughable sitting here thinking that it's
> all a computer game, but I had two guys both wanting
> to group with me last night but each didn't want the
> other one around. The one I didn't group with kept
> contacting me with messages trying to find out if I
> was through with the other guy yet, and telling me how
> he knew better places to go. I want go into all the
> details, but I couldn't help but laugh.
> :o)
> OK, and the questions:
> Is it normal for guys to start calling you "babe"
> after you have grouped for a couple hours, and start
> trying to use the /hug and /kiss command, or do I just
> find all the "good" :o) ones? Is there a slap command,
> I didn't think of that last night but I guess I'll
> have to check that one out.
> :o)
> If there is someone you have grouped with a couple
> times and, well, they are kind of a looser, is there a
> nice way to avoid them, not let them know if you are
> online etc. without just telling them flat out? (By
> looser I'm saying this particular character is non
> comunicative, a problem I don't have, and never seems
> to understand me when they do communicate. They group
> and then run off by themselves and die instead of
> letting me come along and help, they are very quick
> and whenever we, usually I, kill something they always
> grab whatever it is carrying faster than I can. I
> don't want to be rude, and I don't want to hurt
> anyones feelings but I don't really want to group with
> them either, because it's not fun.
> The bad part is that they badgered me into agreeing to
> meet them Sat to group. Yes, I'm a wimp. Should I try
> to sit down and have a heart to heart talk with them
> about what they are doing wrong?
> Suggestions please!
> Not sure how to handle it and thought maybe someone
> here might have been there and done that and could
> pass on a bit of advice.
>
> Thanks for listening anyway,
> Hugs,
> :o)
> Brangvyne
> Ranger - 11th lvl
>
> --- Christina Norman <tina@...>
> wrote:
> >

> > for reasons of
